headline.main: FROM GEN. LYON'S COMMAND.; THE START FROM BOONEVILLE--NUMBER OF TROOPS IN THE EXPEDITION--GEN. LYON AND HIS BODY GUARD--THE FOURTH OF JULY, ETC.

docs.snippet: The force intrenched at Laurel Hill evacuated their position on last Friday night, leaving their camp equipage and sick and wounded, taking the road towards Beverly. When within three miles of Bevery, they met retreating rebels from Gen. McCLELLEN'S...

headline.main: LATEST NEWS OF THE REBELLION.; FURTHER PARTICULARS OF GARNETT'S DEFEAT AND DEATH. DISPATCH FROM WASHINGTON. REPORTS FROM ALEXANDRIA. REBEL CAVALRY CAPTURED. IMPORTANT FROM MISSOURI. LATEST REPORTS FROM MISSOURI. GOV. HICKS IN BALTIMORE. THE PENNSYLVANIA TROOPS AT CAMP WASHINGTON. MILITARY AND NAVAL MOVEMENTS. AID FOR THE SICK AND WOUNDED. ASSISTANCE FOR THE FAMILIES OF OUR SOLDIERS. CAUTION TO PILOTS.

docs.lead_paragraph: The force intrenched at Laurel Hill evacuated their position on last Friday night, leaving their camp equipage and sick and wounded, taking the road towards Beverly. When within three miles of Bevery, they met retreating rebels from Gen. McCLELLEN'S front at Rich Mountain. They then started on the road to St. George.

docs.snippet: BROOKLYN, CENTRAL AND JAMAICA RAILROAD. ?The old railroad from the South ferry, Brooklyn, to Jamaica, under its present management, is operated efficiently, successfully, and to the satisfaction of the traveling public.

docs.snippet: The steamship Columbia, from Havana on the 10th instant at 5 O'clock P.M., reached this port yesterday, having made the passage in three days and fourteen hours.

headline.main: IMPORTANT FROM HAVANA.; The Privatrer Steamer Sumter Heard From. Eight Vessels Captured by Her on the South Coast of Cuba. Seven of Them Taken into Cienfuegos and the Eighth Burned.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Columbia, from Havana on the 10th instant at 5 O'clock P.M., reached this port yesterday, having made the passage in three days and fourteen hours.

headline.main: Is Treason to be Indiscriminately Pardoned?

docs.snippet: It is probable that Ex-Postmaster HOLT will be appointed a Judge of the Supreme Court. Mr. JAMES LESLIE, Jr., of Pennsylvania, succeeds Mr.SANDERSON as Chief Clerk in the War Department. He is admirably qualified for the place.
docs.lead_paragraph: It is probable that Ex-Postmaster HOLT will be appointed a Judge of the Supreme Court. Mr. JAMES LESLIE, Jr., of Pennsylvania, succeeds Mr.SANDERSON as Chief Clerk in the War Department. He is admirably qualified for the place.

docs.snippet: To OUR FELLOW-CITIZENS: The Committee, addressed in the subjoined letter from Dr. BELLOWS, the President of the Sanitary Commission, earnestly entreat your immediate and hearty cooperation in the noble undertaking it so ably advocates.

headline.main: SANITARY COMMISSION.; Appeal of the Executive Finance Committee in the City of New-York.

docs.lead_paragraph: To OUR FELLOW-CITIZENS: The Committee, addressed in the subjoined letter from Dr. BELLOWS, the President of the Sanitary Commission, earnestly entreat your immediate and hearty cooperation in the noble undertaking it so ably advocates.
